intro: Mycetia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy mycetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Caesalpiniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, hairy leaflets that give it a unique appearance. The flowers are arranged in panicles and are known to attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
